item.title: Novo to Cut Workforce by 11%, CEO Lowers Profit Forecast
item.description: Novo Nordisk A/S will cut 9,000 jobs globally and reduce its profit forecast for the third time this year as the maker of Ozempic and Wegovy aims to save 8 billion kroner ($1.3 billion) by the end of

item.title: WHO Adds Ozempic and Mounjaro to Its List of Essential Medicines
item.description: The World Health Organization added Novo Nordisk A/S’s Ozempic and Eli Lilly & Co.’s Mounjaro to its list of essential medicines, a step that may expand access to the drugs around the world.

item.title: Novo Nordisk Woes and Trump’s Tariffs Dent Danish Growth Outlook
item.description: Denmark’s central bank will cut its economic outlook for 2025 substantially because of weaker sales growth at Novo Nordisk A/S and US tariffs, according to its governor.

item.title: European Stocks Subdued After Glum Novo Nordisk, Bayer Earnings
item.description: European stocks were muted on Wednesday following a slate of underwhelming results, including those from Bayer AG and Novo Nordisk A/S.

item.title: Denmark’s Economy Runs on Novo. Will the Drugmaker’s Troubles Slim It Down?
item.description: Denmark’s status as one of the few countries in Europe with an expanding economy rests in part on the success of its homegrown hero, Novo Nordisk A/S. Thanks to the pharmaceutical giant’s astronomical

item.title: Novo Nordisk Shares Post Worst Ever Week as Optimism Wanes
item.description: Just six weeks ago, things seemed to be getting better for Novo Nordisk A/S. Investors were optimistic, and the Danish drugmaker was briefly Europe’s most valuable public company again. Now, the stock

item.title: Novo Is to Lilly What LVMH Is to Hermes, Fund Manager Reckons
item.description: A widening gulf between the stock performances of Novo Nordisk A/S and its main competitor Eli Lilly & Co has drawn comparison with two of the world’s largest luxury-goods makers.

item.title: Novo Picks Insider as CEO After Selloff From Wegovy Slump
item.description: Novo Nordisk A/S named its head of international operations as chief executive officer after slumping weight-loss drug sales led to a profit warning that wiped $93 billion off its market value.
